task_description: Facing the building to your North-East (approx. 33°), estimate the height of the main building in front of you in meters. Answer with one number and a short rationale.

reason: I need to see the building’s base and roofline clearly, so I should tilt up to capture the top while staying aligned toward the NE-facing facade.
I’m now facing due north rather than the target NE (~33°), so I should yaw right about 33° while keeping the upward pitch to keep the roofline in view.
I need to see the building’s full height from ground to roof, so I should step slightly to adjust vantage point while keeping it in front, choosing the forward-left node for a closer, clearer view.
After moving I’m now oriented NW (325°) and likely off-target, so I should yaw right about 68° to face the intended NE (~33°) direction toward the building.
I overshot the target heading and need to realign from 68° back to ~33° to face the building’s main facade for height estimation.
I’m again facing NW (325°) and must turn to NE (~33°), so a right yaw of about 68° will align me with the target building.
To face the building at ~33° NE from my current 68° heading, I should rotate left by about 35° while keeping level pitch to judge floors and roofline.
The view keeps snapping back to 325° NW, so I should use the provided absolute-look option to set heading directly to 33° and keep pitch level to estimate the building height.
I need to stop oscillating and instead take the estimate from the building in view at this position; I will look up to capture roofline for a height estimate and then report.
I need to face the target building at ~33° NE and then provide the height estimate, so I will yaw right 33° while keeping the upward pitch to include the roofline.
Now that I’m correctly aligned at ~33° NE, I should look up to capture the roofline and count apparent stories for a height estimate before stopping.
The view has reset to 0°N, so I should rotate right to 33°NE to face the target building and then provide the height estimate.
I’m finally aligned to the NE-facing building, so I should stop and report an estimated height based on an apparent ~3-story facade plus roof structure (~3.5 m per story).
